availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Stewart (Johnson County, KY, lawyer)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, lawyer. Kentucky native. Son of Ralph Stewart and America Stewart. Married to Cynthia F. Mayo Stewart in Johnson County, Kentucky, on January 11, 1860. Father of James L. Stewart and John W.M. Stewart. Farmer in Lawrence County, Kentucky, in 1850. Lawyer in Johnson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 110B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 149.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Johns Creek, p. 153A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, Film 001912950, p. 61.
"Judge James Elliott Stewart (1832-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial 133180525, accessed November 9, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133180525.
